nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: The night is heavy. The oil lamp flickers, casting long shadows against the mud walls. Your mother sits in the corner, mending a garment that looks too large for you.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: The bar is solid, but the rats gnawing in the thatch sound like footsteps. You cannot rest.

nodes.speaker: Mother
nodes.text: You are restless, my son. The water in the jar has been boiling for some time.

choices.text: I am waiting for the time.

nodes.speaker: Mother
nodes.text: Your father died on this night, sixteen years ago. His head hangs in the King's city. Do you still remember what you promised?

choices.text: I will bring his head back.
I need to know why he died first.

nodes.speaker: Mother
nodes.text: Good. The iron is cold, but the blood is still hot. Take the bundle under the bed. It is time to go.

nodes.speaker: Mother
nodes.text: Knowledge is a heavy burden, sometimes heavier than a sword. But if that is your will... take the bundle. Go.
